intro: Amphilophis pertusa, commonly known as the red-tipped nettle, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive red tip. Its small green flowers are arranged in clusters and are typically wind-pollinated. The plant contains irritant hairs that can cause skin irritation upon contact.
